result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin L Schickling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $147.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days.  FTP w/b warrant.

Restitution to be determined.
AMENDED 10/12/11 by Judge Harrington: Restitution $0.00 - no victims
Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess fire arms or other weapons.  May not vote.
Must perform all services/treatment/evaluations as determined by Probation.

timeConds.notes: 1 year in the Polk County Jail - Eligible for Huber.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
